node.title: NSW Premier orders review of how grants are handed out after new  pork barrelling claims
node.alt: A smartly-dressed man wearing glasses speaks to the camera with a woman visible out of focus to the side.
node.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says he isÂ committed to making sure the grants process is fair after his predecessor Gladys Berejiklian's appearance before the corruption watchdog put government pork barrelling back in the headlines.
node.content: ["Premier Dominic Perrottet has announced a review into grants programs in NSW, after his predecessor Gladys Berejiklian's appearance before the corruption watchdog put government pork barrelling back in the headlines.", "But Mr Perrottet denied the move was an acknowledgement\u00a0that there were failings in the way some of the grants examined by the Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) were awarded.", "In her evidence to the ICAC, Ms Berejiklian said the government \"threw money\" at government seats\u00a0in order to win them.", "As premier, she had already conceded that more than $100 million in council grants approved in the lead up to the 2019 state election amounted to pork barrelling.", "\"It's not something the community likes.. but it's an accusation I will wear,\" she said at the time.", "\"It's not an illegal practice. Unfortunately it does happen from time to time by every government.\"", "Former deputy premier John Barilaro also didn't shy away from the practice, previously saying he was proud of his nickname \"Pork Barilaro\".", "Mr Perrottet was treasurer in the lead-up to the 2019 state election and signed off on all the grants handed out.", "But when asked directly if the review was a concession the grants were not handed out with the principles of transparency, probity and accountability in mind, Mr Perrottet responded with a firm \"No\".", "He said he was committed to making sure the grants process was\u00a0fair.", "The Premier also denied Opposition claims that another government grants scheme for renewable energy in schools represented pork barrelling \"on a staggering scale\".", "Documents show that 92 per cent of schools that were awarded grants as part of a renewable energy pilot program were in government held seats.", "Opposition Leader Chris Minns said it was another example of blatant pork barrelling.", "\"It's indicative of a government that's putting their own needs ahead of the best interests of the people of NSW,\" Mr Minns said.", "\"Everybody in this state pays taxes, they should expect to have government spending based on need\u00a0and not the political needs of the Liberal Party.\"", "But Mr Perrottet said the process for the grants scheme was not political.", "\"My understanding is that program was driven through the department of education and they provided advice to the NSW government in terms of where their need is.", "\"This is not about Labor seats, Liberal seats, Greens seats, it doesn't bother me.", "\"What's most important is that government investment goes where the need is and drives benefits.\"", "The review into the grants schemes will be led by the Department of Premier and Cabinet in partnership with the Productivity Commissioner, Peter Achterstraat.", "It will focus on ensuring the programs achieve value for public money, are robust in their planning and design and adopt the key principles of transparency, accountability and probity.", "The final report will be delivered in April next year."]
